info.title: Netbox Overlay for LDAP subscriber management API
info.description: API overlay to allow automatic allocation of static IP addresses using Netbox.

requestBody.description: Post the necessary fields for the API to create a new subscriber.

subscriber.title: subscriber
subscriber.description:
A subscriber - A user authenticating via the RADIUS service.

Note: The attributes listed in the definition of the object are a subset of the attributes available.

Any attribute that's available in the relevant LDAP schema (freeradius-radius.schema, freeradius-dhcpv4.schema, freeradius-dhcpv6.schema, etc...) for the protocol, can be included in POST, PATCH, PUT actions, including generic attributes such as `radiusAttribute`.  Generic attributes take the format `<attribute> <op> <quote><value><quote>` e.g. `Reply-Message := "Welcome user %{User-Name}"`, and can be used to add any attribute allowed in the protocol dictionary.

For the NetBox overlay, radiusFramedIPAddress, radiusFramedIPv6Address, radiusFramedIPv6Prefix, are used to request or retain IP addresses.

IPv4 attributes populated with `0.0.0.0` will be replaced with allocations from Netbox.  IPv6 attributes with `::` or `::/<prefix_len>` in the case of the prefix attribute, will also be replaced with allocations from Netbox.

When PUTing, and fewer than the existing allocation of IP addresses are included in the request body, the IP addresses retained will be dictated by the ones specified.  For example, a PUT against a subscriber containing allocations `{ "radiusFramedIPAddress" : [ "192.68.0.1", "192.168.0.2", "192.168.0.3" ] }` with `{ "radiusFramedIPaddress" : [ "192.168.0.1" ] }` will cause the deallocation of `192.168.0.2` and `192.168.0.3`.  If the caller does not care which IP addresses are retained, they may submit an array containing only zeroed IP address elements, with the element count being the number of addresses to retain.

`netboxSubscriberName`, and `netboxGroup` are required the first time a static IP is allocated to a subscriber, as they are used to create the Netbox tenant.

`netboxCo` must be included in any call which modifies IP allocation or the call will fail.

subscriberId.description: A unique (within a realm) identifier for a subscriber

serviceStatus.description: Whether this subscriber can access the service

statusReason.description: Why the subscriber's service was disabled or suspended

serviceId.description: The type of access media this subscriber object relates to, e.g. fixedLine, wireless etc... Must match a configured service category

servicePrecedence.description: If multiple subscriber objects match an incoming Access-Request, the first subscriber object with "primary" will be used

serviceProfile.description: The URI of a service profile object to apply to the subscriber

serviceProfileSuspended.description: The URI of a service profile object to apply to the subscriber

clientGroup.description: The URI(s) of a clientGroup to restrict subscriber to.  Prevents subscriber from connecting RADIUS clients outside of this set of groups

subscriberGroup.description: The URI of a subscriberGroup object.  Used to apply common sets of RADIUS attributes or serviceProfiles to subscriber

portBindingclient.description: URI of the last client the subscriber authenticated via.  Primarily used for Change of Authorisation and disconnect messages

portBindingIdentifier.description: The subscriber's unique circuit ID, either learned or pre-provisioned

portBindingModified.description: When port binding details were last updated

portBinding.description: If true, the subscriber will be unabled to authenticate via any other circuit than the one we learned the first time the subscriber authenticated

netboxSubscriberName.description: Firstname, Lastname of the subscriber to record in Netbox.  Will not be stored in LDAP.

netboxGroup.description: The netbox group to add a subscriber to.  Not stored in LDAP.

netboxCo.description: The CO to allocate IPv4, IPv6 WAN and IPv6 PD addresses from.

radiusFramedIPAddress.description: An IPv4 address to request (0.0.0.0), or retain (any valid IPv4 address).

radiusFramedIPv6Address.description: An IPv6 address to request (::), or retain (any valid IPv6 address)

radiusFramedIPv6Prefix.description: An IPv6 address to request (::/<prefix_len>), or retain (any valid IPv6 prefix)

onCreate.description: Response on creating a new object

Location.description: The URI of the resource that was just created

onInternalServerError.description: An internal error has occurred while talking to one of the backend (LDAP or Postgres). For instance, an attribute was missing when creating an object

error_msg.description: Raw error string from the service element which experienced the error

onSuccess.description: Response sent on a successful operation which did not create an object

onConflict.description: The requested operation conflicts with an existing resource (for instance, trying to create a duplicate resource) or you are trying to delete a node that has children

onBadRequest.description:
Can be any of the following:
- The requested path doesnâ€™t correspond to the schema.
- Missing or invalid data for POST or PUT operations. Data should always be valid JSON.
- If data contains URL to another resource, the host part of the URL must be identical to the host data being created/modified.
